Posts.Content: Bless you, it sounds like you have inherited some of your Nana's spirit. It's always the ones left behind that hurt, but they say, while someone is here who can remember that person, then they haven't really gone far. Wishing for you and your family to keep each other strong, hugs Tallyxx
Posts.Title: A Fighter To The End

Posts.Content: Thanks ladies...I'm really hoping for the best news possible....aren't we all.....it will be 25 days from the op...practically a month...maybe the longer the wait, the better the news......I did say maybe, fingers crossed.
Posts.Title: Newbie here

Posts.Content: Results, just about as good as they can be apparently....the 1.2cm lump turned into a 2.2 cm one, all removed, with a tiny amount of cells found in one lymph node. Possibility of radiotherapy to the lymph nodes as well as the breast, and to take arimidex for the next 5 years, Better than most, so I'm not complaining...
Posts.Title: Newbie here

Posts.Content: Forgot to say hormone receptor positive...thats good?????
Posts.Title: Newbie here

Posts.Content: My, this is a difficult place to keep track on, so many avenue's and corridors, I could still be in the wrong place...lol, but that's just me, thick as a milkshake. I had my op on the 11th dec, lumpectomy and a few lymph nodes removed....now waiting results next week.... I've been reading about scans, MRI/CT, does this apply to everyone?...or just certain results, say as of yet I've no idea...the consultant did say I would be having radiotherapy...25 sessions, but don't know when yet..... I'll get use to this forum eventually, please bare with me.......thanks I'm in Nottingham, anyone else?

Posts.Content: diprobase...not heard of that one, is that the same/similar to the aqueous cream..good  idea about the nursing pads, thanks
Posts.Title: Newbie here

Posts.Content: Hi, thanks for the replies, and yes of course I will be asking the doctor next week, it's just that there are so many different things happening to different people I wondered if there was any sort of basic level of treatment.......just have to wait a few more days, even though a day feels like 3 days...
Posts.Title: Newbie here

Posts.Content: Morning all. I've just had # 21 out of 33, (25 plus 8 boosters)  the  boob is doing well but a small area in the armpit has started weeping and is really sore this bank holiday weekend, typical, having rads to shoulder area as well and that is very very red but holding.l
